page.title: 16LLANNEFYDD VILLAGE HALL
page.content: In the middle of the village stands the new{Village Hall}built to replace the previous sink Nissan hut obtained after World War II.The building of the new hall began in December 1963 and it was opened on 6 April 1966.Its cost was{Â£13186}and{Â£2000}of this was raised in one evening with an animal and goods auction.The hall seats 250 people. The present hiring charge is Â£7 but the stage or committee room costs Â£2.The Y.F.C. use it regularly during the winter months and the playschool every Thursday.There are concerts and plays held in the hall,and most local organisations use it as well.Some wedding receptions have been held in the hall and also many fund-raising dances.The hall has been awarded 2nd prize twice in a'best kept hall' competition.A committee of parishoners manage the hall.
